goals: to establish a foundation for further research in Chinese generative grammar.
A special focus is on “Principle and Parameter” (P&P) theory approaches, but this course will also touch upon issues under a perspective of Minimalist syntax when relevant.
syllabus:
Course objective

This course is intended to establish a foundation for further research in Chinese generative grammar. Such being the case, it is concerned with the issues and topics which have been of central significance in the recent development of Chinese syntax. The main reading material for this course is “The Syntax of Chinese” by Huang, Li and Li (2009), supplemented by other important works, both classical and up-to-date, in Chinese syntax. This course will enhance the understanding of Universal Grammar by exploring the syntactic mechanism of Chinese and therefore will benefit students who are interested in syntactic theory, Chinese syntax or interfaces between syntax and other linguistic areas (such as sentence processing, L1 or L2 acquisition, etc.) in Chinese.
